title: Sri Lanka bars public gatherings amid curfew till April 04
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Sri Lanka has barred public gatherings under emergency laws until April 04 when a curfew is also in effect amid an attempts by social media activists to hold protests over an economic crisis.

A gazette notice under the hand of by President Gotabaya Rajapaksa ordered that “no person shall be on any public road, railway, public park, public recreation ground or other public ground or the seashore in such areas…”
Permission had to be sought from the Secretary of the Ministry of Defense, the secretary of the Ministry of Public Security or the Inspector General of Police
Overnight groups of persons defied a curfew to gather in protests.
Social media activists were planning nation-wide peaceful protests at 0300 April 04 over an economic crisis, triggered by money printed to have a ‘production economy’.
